response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (22-year-old male)", "medium", "Young age is associated with higher recidivism risk, although not extreme in isolation."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Race is not a strong independent predictor in risk assessments, so this factor is considered low risk."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest and conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest and conviction increase the likelihood of reoffending, representing a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Family/Marital Status (Married, living with spouse)", "low", "Stable family support and marital status are protective factors, lowering recidivism risk."],
    ["Education (High school diploma, enrolled in 4-year college)", "low", "Ongoing education is a protective factor that generally reduces recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment (Held 2 jobs during the year)", "low", "Some employment stability is present, which is protective and lowers risk."],
    ["Substance Use (Past 4 years marijuana use)", "medium", "Recent substance use indicates moderate risk, even if marijuana is less severe than other drugs."],
    ["Mental Health (No recent depression)", "low", "Absence of depressive symptoms reduces the complexity of risk factors."],
    ["Childhood Environment (Lived with both biological parents in a household of 3)", "low", "A stable childhood home is protective and tends to lower recidivism risk."],
    ["Location (Urban area)", "medium", "Urban environments can correlate with higher recidivism rates, posing a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Religiosity (Believes God influences events)", "low", "A personal religious belief can act as a protective factor by providing moral guidance and community support."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with higher recidivism risk, although not extreme in isolation.
Race is not a strong independent predictor in risk assessments, so this factor is considered low risk.
A prior arrest and conviction increase the likelihood of reoffending, representing a moderate risk factor.
Stable family support and marital status are protective factors, lowering recidivism risk.
Education (High school diploma, enrolled in 4-year college)
Ongoing education is a protective factor that generally reduces recidivism risk.
Some employment stability is present, which is protective and lowers risk.
Recent substance use indicates moderate risk, even if marijuana is less severe than other drugs.
Absence of depressive symptoms reduces the complexity of risk factors.
Childhood Environment (Lived with both biological parents in a household of 3)
A stable childhood home is protective and tends to lower recidivism risk.
Urban environments can correlate with higher recidivism rates, posing a moderate risk factor.
A personal religious belief can act as a protective factor by providing moral guidance and community support.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 190 lbs. He is married and is currently living with his spouse. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
